intro: Hieracium haussknechtianum, commonly known as the Haussknecht's hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in meadows, grasslands, and rocky areas, preferring well-drained soils. It produces yellow flowers with a central disk surrounded by ray florets, and its leaves are usually hairy and lance-shaped. Hieracium haussknechtianum is often found in open habitats and can be an indicator of disturbed or nutrient-rich environments.
